wikipedia_page.main: Daniel Frederick Morgan (born 4 November 1984) is an English football forward who was last attached to Grays Athletic. He played six games in the Football League for Oxford United.

response: Ahead of the 2005–06 season, Hackett was linked with a surprise move to French giant Olympique de Marseille, but it went no further than a trial. He started the season well, setting up the equalising goal for Chris Hargreaves in a 1–1 draw against Grimsby Town in the opening game of the season. A week later on 13 August 2006, Hackett scored his first goal of the season, as well as setting up a goal for Danny Morgan, in a 2–2 draw against Wycombe Wanderers. His second goal of the season then came on 13 September 2005, in a 1–1 draw against Bristol Rovers. Hackett appeared in every match from the start of the season until a calf injury at the end of September. He returned from injury on 7 October 2005 in a 1–0 win over Carlisle United. He was again suspended for three matches after being sent off for a dangerous two-footed challenge on Andy Parkinson, in a 3–2 loss against Grimsby Town on 25 November 2005. He returned from suspension on 13 December 2005, starting as Oxford United lost 2–1 to Cheltenham Town in an FA Cup second-round replay. In his final season for Oxford, he made 27 appearances scoring twice in league matches.
*Danny Morgan (boxer) (born 1961), retired professional super middleweight boxer from Minneapolis, Minnesota
*Danny Morgan (Australian footballer) (born 1974), former Australian rules footballer
